intro: Sanguisorba pimpinella, commonly known as the lesser dropwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible or medicinal properties. The plant features upright, slender stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often reddish or purple-tinged. Its small, clustered flowers appear in late summer, typically in shades of pink or red, adding ornamental value to gardens. Sanguisorba pimpinella is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
